marketNews.title: RI Sends Proposal for US Tariff Negotiations
marketNews.content: The Indonesian Government on Tuesday (8/4) announced its response regarding the reciprocal tariffs imposed by the US. In principle, President Prabowo Subianto stated that Indonesia will pursue negotiation routes with the US, including revitalizing trade and investment agreements that have not been updated since 1996. The Indonesian Government is formulating several policies to be offered as a negotiation package with the US, including: Deregulation of Non-Tariff Measures (NTMs). Finance Minister, Sri Mulyani, stated that the NTMs option was chosen after observing the US rejection of Vietnam's proposal to offer a 0% US import tariff. The US rejection of Vietnam's proposal was because the US also considers non-tariff barriers in its reciprocal tariff negotiations. The NTMs proposed by the Indonesian government include: 1) relaxation of the local content level (TKDN) requirement in the technology, information, and communication (ICT) sector from the US; 2) evaluation of import trade schemes, such as simplification/removal of import quotas/technical licensing; and 3) acceleration of halal certification. Currently, Indonesia imposes a minimum TKDN obligation of 25%, with some ICT products required to have a minimum TKDN of 35%. Increase in Imports from the US. This increase aims to balance Indonesia's trade balance with the US. For context, Indonesia recorded a trade surplus with the US of 19.3 billion US dollars during 2024, which is the fourth largest in Southeast Asia. Going forward, the Indonesian government plans to increase imports originating from the US, covering agricultural products such as soybeans and wheat, engineering equipment, and oil and gas products such as LPG. Currently, the US fulfills 89% of Indonesia's soybean import needs, 5% of wheat, 5% of engineering equipment, and 53% of LPG. Fiscal Incentives. Several incentives are also prepared to facilitate business ease, including for entrepreneurs from the US. Some fiscal incentives prepared include the acceleration and simplification of various taxation processes (such as audits and restitutions) and adjustments to various tariffs (Income Tax on imports, import duties for US products, and export duties for palm oil products). Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs, Airlangga Hartarto, said that the Indonesian government has sent a letter to the US government regarding this negotiation package. Key Takeaway: Generally, business relaxation in the form of deregulation of TKDN provisions and/or relaxation of import provisions has the potential to increase competition for domestic manufacturers, although it may benefit consumers. Furthermore, the adjustment of various tariffs and duties has the potential to reduce Indonesia's state revenue potential. These various risks could be compensated if Indonesia successfully obtains a negotiation agreement, which could smooth Indonesia's path to increasing its export market share to the US (trade diversion). Investors need to monitor developments and details related to tariff negotiations which are potentially still dynamic. We advise investors to avoid panic selling and stay invested if investors believe that the stocks they invest in have good fundamentals. History shows that the market can recover from crises, such as in 2008 and 2020. Furthermore, having a diversified portfolio across different asset classes can help minimize the impact of market volatility. Investors may consider short-term government bonds that have lower volatility - such as PBS003 and ST014-T2 - or money market mutual funds.

marketNews.title: US President Donald Trump Decided to Increase Import Tariffs for China by +50 Percentage Points
marketNews.content: US President, Donald Trump, on Tuesday (8/4) decided to increase import tariffs for China by +50 percentage points, bringing the total import tariff imposed by the US on China to 104%, which will take effect from Wednesday (9/4) early morning. This step is a follow-up to China's retaliation against the US reciprocal tariffs. Previously, China was subject to a 20% tariff and a reciprocal tariff of 34%. Responding to this, the Chinese government on Wednesday (9/4) announced an increase in tariffs for imports originating from the US from 34% to 84% effective April 10, 2025, and stated it will sue the US at the World Trade Organization (WTO). US President, Donald Trump, on Tuesday (8/4) signaled that the US is open to making deals that could reduce or eliminate higher reciprocal tariffs for 57 countries. Trump's statement emerged amidst plans by leaders of countries in Asia and Europe to negotiate with the US government. Nevertheless, Trump proceeded with implementing higher reciprocal tariffs for 57 countries effective Wednesday (9/4) early morning. US President, Donald Trump, on Tuesday (8/4) signed 4 executive orders aimed at boosting the coal industry. Based on these orders, Trump used his emergency authority to allow several old coal-fired power plants scheduled for retirement to continue producing electricity to meet increasing US electricity demand amid growth in data centers, AI, and electric cars. Trump also directed federal government agencies to identify coal resources on federal lands, remove barriers to coal mining, and prioritize the leasing of coal mines on US land.

marketNews.title: Rupiah Exchange Rate Hits All-Time Low, Bank Indonesia to Intervene
marketNews.content: The rupiah exchange rate against the US dollar fell -0.5% to the level of 16,957 in Wednesday's (9/4) intraday trading, marking an all-time low record. Responding to this, Deputy Senior Governor of Bank Indonesia, Destry Damayanti, said that the central bank will act boldly to maintain rupiah stability by intervening in the spot market, the domestic non-deliverable forwards market, and the bond market. Destry explained that regional currencies weakened due to the escalation of the global trade war, especially the US decision to raise import tariffs for China to 104%.

marketNews.title: State Budget Deficit Reaches Rp104.2 Trillion in 3M25
marketNews.content: The Ministry of Finance reported that the State Budget (APBN) deficit for the first three months of 2025 (3M25) reached 104.2 trillion rupiah or 0.43% of GDP (vs. March 2024: 0.04% surplus of GDP, 2025 target: 2.53% deficit of GDP). State revenue realization during 3M25 decreased by -16.8% YoY to 516.1 trillion rupiah, equivalent to 17.2% of the 2025 target. Meanwhile, state expenditures realization increased by +1.4% YoY to 620.3 trillion rupiah, equivalent to 17.1% of the 2025 target. This result caused the primary balance surplus to slow down to 17.5 trillion rupiah (vs. March 2024: 122.1 trillion rupiah surplus, 2025 target: 63.3 trillion rupiah deficit). Meanwhile, budget financing has reached 250 trillion rupiah, equivalent to 40.6% of the 2025 target (vs. March 2024: 83.97 trillion rupiah).

marketNews.title: ESDM Minister: Royalty Rate Hike for Minerals and Coal to Take Effect Next Week
marketNews.content: Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources, Bahlil Lahadalia, said on Wednesday (9/4) that the implementation of the royalty rate hike for minerals and coal (minerba) will start to take effect in the second week of April 2025. Previously, the Director General at the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources, Tri Winarno, stated last month that the minerba royalty rate increase would follow the proposal presented in the public consultation on March 8, 2025.

tickerNews.title: ADRO: Buyback Plan Up to IDR 4 Trillion
tickerNews.content: ADRO: Alamtri Resources Indonesia plans a buyback of up to ~926.8 million (3.01%) shares with a fund allocation of up to 4 trillion rupiah. This plan will be discussed at the GMS on May 15, 2025, with the buyback execution period running up to 12 months from May 16, 2025.

tickerNews.title: ITMG Shareholders Approve Final Dividend for 2024 Book Year of $153 Million
tickerNews.content: ITMG: Indo Tambangraya Megah shareholders on Wednesday (9/4) approved the final dividend distribution plan for the 2024 book year amounting to 153 million US dollars or 2,245 rupiah per share, indicating a final dividend yield of 9.9% as of Wednesday (9/4). Previously, ITMG also distributed an interim dividend for the 2024 book year of 1,228 rupiah per share in September 2024.

tickerNews.title: MIDI Reports +12.46% SSSG in 1Q25 and Divests 70% Stake in Lawson Operator
tickerNews.content: MIDI: Midi Utama Indonesia recorded Same Store Sales Growth (SSSG) of +12.46% YoY in 1Q25 (vs. 1Q24: +13.67% YoY, 4Q24: +9.13% YoY), exceeding the 2025 target in the mid-single digit range. MIDI also reported opening 34 new stores in 1Q25, equivalent to 17% of the 2025 target of 200 new stores, bringing the total number of Alfamidi stores to 2,469 units as of the end of 1Q25. Furthermore, MIDI announced it had signed an agreement to divest its entire ownership (70% stake) in Lawson operator, PT Lancar Wiguna Sejahtera, for approximately 200.5 billion rupiah to its controller, Sumber Alfaria Trijaya (AMRT). This transaction, which will be completed no later than June 2025, is intended to allow MIDI to focus on its business portfolio, with divestment proceeds to be used for working capital and capital expenditure.

tickerNews.title: ROTI to Distribute 2024 Final Dividend of IDR 450 Billion
tickerNews.content: ROTI: Nippon Indosari Corpindo will distribute the 2024 book year dividend amounting to 450 billion rupiah or 79.44 rupiah per share, equivalent to a dividend payout ratio of ~125%. The cum date on the regular and negotiation markets is April 16, 2025, while payment will be on April 28, 2025. Referring to the ROTI stock price at the market close on Wednesday (9/4) at 910 rupiah per share, the indicative dividend yield is 8.7%.

tickerNews.title: HAIS to Distribute 2024 Final Dividend of ~IDR 40.4 Billion
tickerNews.content: HAIS: Hasnur Internasional Shipping will distribute the 2024 book year dividend amounting to ~40.4 billion rupiah or 15.37 rupiah per share, equivalent to a dividend payout ratio of ~33.3%. The cum date on the regular and negotiation markets is April 14, 2025, while payment will be on May 8, 2025. Referring to the HAIS stock price at the market close on Wednesday (9/4) at 197 rupiah per share, the indicative dividend yield is 7.8%.

tickerNews.title: HEAL's President Director Buys Shares; Realizes Buyback of IDR 5 Billion
tickerNews.content: HEAL: The controller and President Director of Medikaloka Hermina, Hasmoro, purchased ~2.2 million HEAL shares at an average price of ~1,108 rupiah per share on March 20-21, 2025. The total transaction value reached ~2.5 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Hasmoro's ownership in HEAL increased from 4.7558% to 4.7704%. In a separate information disclosure, HEAL announced it had realized a buyback of 5 million shares on April 8, 2025, at an average price of 1,000 rupiah per share or a total value of ~5 billion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: ISAT's President Director Vikram Sinha Purchases Shares, Increasing Stake
tickerNews.content: ISAT: Indosat's President Director, Vikram Sinha, purchased ~3.7 million ISAT shares at an average price of 1,357 rupiah per share on March 24, 2025. The total transaction value reached ~5 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Vikram's ownership in ISAT increased from 0.0129% to 0.0243%.

tickerNews.title: AKRA Controller Soegiarto Adikoesoemo Buys Shares Worth ~IDR 4.8 Billion
tickerNews.content: AKRA: AKR Corporindo's Controller and President Commissioner, Soegiarto Adikoesoemo, purchased 4.4 million AKRA shares at an average price of 1,094 rupiah per share on March 24-26, 2025. The total transaction value reached ~4.8 billion rupiah. After this transaction, the direct ownership of Soegiarto Adikoesoemo in AKRA increased from 0.65% to 0.67%.

tickerNews.title: AMRT Controller Sells ~1.25 Billion Shares for ~IDR 2.5 Trillion
tickerNews.content: AMRT: Sumber Alfaria Trijaya's controller, PT Sigmantara Alfindo, sold ~1.25 billion AMRT shares at a price of 2,000 rupiah per share on March 25, 2025. The total transaction value reached ~2.5 trillion rupiah. After this transaction, PT Sigmantara Alfindo's ownership in AMRT decreased from 53.19% to 50.19%.

tickerNews.title: TOBA Subsidiary Receives S$300 Million in Credit Facilities from DBS Ltd
tickerNews.content: TBS Energi Utama (TOBA) through its subsidiary, Sembcorp Environment Pte. Ltd., obtained a credit facility consisting of a term facility commitment of 270 million Singapore dollars and a revolving facility commitment of 30 million Singapore dollars from DBS Ltd. This facility is intended to support the execution and development of the company's business plan.

tickerNews.title: Petrosea Signs Nickel Mining Service Contract Worth IDR 16 Trillion with Vale Indonesia (INCO)
tickerNews.content: Petrosea (PTRO) announced it has signed a nickel mining service contract worth 16 trillion rupiah for the Bahodopi Block owned by Vale Indonesia (INCO) with a contract period of 10 years. Previously, the plan for awarding this service contract was announced by INCO in January 2025.

tickerNews.title: MDIY Controller Tan Yu Yeh Increases Indirect Ownership Through Share Purchase
tickerNews.content: The controller of Daya Intiguna Yasa (MDIY), Tan Yu Yeh, purchased 890,700 thousand MDIY shares through Sky Venture Ltd. at a price of 1,319 rupiah per share on March 26-27, 2025. The total transaction value reached ~1.2 billion rupiah. After this transaction, the indirect ownership of Tan Yu Yeh in MDIY increased, but remained around ~86.04%.
